chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason T Juech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Hertz Rental Car in West Bend, WI.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Mark Jeranek.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd Operate Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, 943.23(3m); Court so orders.  Def enters no contest plea to Ct 1 as amended & Ct 2.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1 & Ct 2.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def in person & by Atty Mark Jeranek.  Atty Stephanie Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Preliminary offer has been rec'd; adj requested.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.   Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with H.R. in West Bend; Supply DNA Sample to WCSD before being released.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Peter Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def refused DNA sample; Court orders def to supply sample before being released - Court informs of expungement rights.  Court sets $2000 signature bond.  Def to retain private counsel.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 09:45 am.
